Psychology_444_r$Psychology_433_p$Psycho.text:
Finding A: Even before treatment started, levels of interleukin-10 were higher among the 18 patients who later developed long-term fatigue, suggesting the immune system may have been primed to overreact, the study authors explained.
Finding B: We focused on neurons that were both color and direction selective using the three-way ANOVA or showed significant color and direction tuning shifts (n = 71) during the DCM task (using different populations led to similar results).
Finding C: While it\'s true that people are generally averse to harming others, the bottom line is that people don\'t feel this way all the time."
Finding D: There was a positive relationship between corporal punishment and physical violence during a romantic relationship.

Psychology_tweet_125_r$Psychology_138_r$.text:
Finding A: #Longevity Coaching Tip O’ the Day-Corporal punishment of children leads to violent adults. Another study.
Finding B: "The results of this study set the stage for the next phase of this research, which is to examine individual components of the networks that have the maturational lag," he says.
Finding C: Finally, we suggest that the adjustments to self-perceptions produced by behaviorally targeted ads may not only improve sales of the featured product at the time of ad exposure, but also future sales of the product and, potentially, of the entire category.
Finding D: These results again suggest that expressions of gratitude are guided by expectations about a recipient\'s reactions, with people choosing to express their gratitude to recipients who they believe will feel positive.

Psychology_tweet_91_r$Psychology_tweet_6.text:
Finding A: Learning a lot about sleep from @username. Naps and sleep are very important for young children to enhance emotional memory. Even more reasons for a daytime siesta.
Finding B: Early pseudomature behavior also predicted higher adult levels of more serious criminal behavior, alcohol and drug use, and problems associated with such use.
Finding C: How sugary drink options are presented influence consumption. #psychology #science
Finding D: Analysis showed a significant positive association between corporal punishment and physical perpetration of dating violence (OR 1.30, 95% CI 1.07-1.59).

Finding B: Spanking alone does not teach children why their behavior was wrong or what they should do instead .
Finding C: Moreover, for both boys and girls, she said, "We found [spanking] linked to more aggression, more delinquent behavior, more mental health problems, worse relationships with parents, and putting the children at higher risk for physical abuse from their parents."

Psychology_0_r$Psychology_432_r$Psycholo.text:
Finding A: Regardless of background, the team explains, "circumcised boys were more likely than intact boys to develop ASD before age 10 years."
Finding B: Sleep allows the brain to reset, helping integrate, newly learned material with consolidated memories, so the brain can begin anew the next day."
Finding C: [related] All participants improved in language skills important for language and reading, but the improvement was greater for those in music classes, compared with the ROTC group.
Finding D: Phonological awareness improved in both training groups from year 1 to year 4, but these gains were larger in the adolescents who underwent in-school music training.
Psychology_0_r$Psychology_432_r$Psycholo.displayed_text:
Finding A: Regardless of background, the team explains, "circumcised boys were more likely than intact boys to develop ASD before age 10 years."
Finding B: Sleep allows the brain to reset, helping integrate, newly learned material with consolidated memories, so the brain can begin anew the next day."
Finding C: [related] All participants improved in language skills important for language and reading, but the improvement was greater for those in music classes, compared with the ROTC group.
Finding D: Phonological awareness improved in both training groups from year 1 to year 4, but these gains were larger in the adolescents who underwent in-school music training.

Psychology_70_p$Psychology_53_r$Psycholo.text:
Finding A: We confirmed our hypothesis that boys who undergo ritual circumcision may run a greater risk of developing ASD.
Finding B: About 19 percent said they had committed some form of dating violence and 69 percent said they were physically punished during childhood.
Finding C: Self-efficacy and support The result: support from their partners is helpful to smokers who wish to stop and it increases their chances of success, provided that they have developed skills of their own that help them to abstain.
Finding D: New research: "pseudomature behaviour predicted difficulties in social functioning ten years later" via @username mag

Finding A: "Sociosexual orientation is a relatively stable tendency toward or away from casual sex, determined by a combination of heritable factors, sociocultural learning, and past experiences, and reflected in three key components: motivation for, attitudes toward, and past experience with casual sex," the authors write.
Finding B: A neural link between poor sleep and depression:
Finding C: The team also noted how individual neurons were able to shift their sensitivity to a particular color and particular direction.

Psychology_230_p$Psychology_56_p$Psychol.text:
Finding A: Given that ΔRecall nap significantly predicted ΔRecall overnight , and both significantly predicted by nap SWA, the preliminary conditions for a mediation analysis were met.
Finding B: The results show that behaviorally targeted ads result in increased purchase intentions for the advertised product, an effect mediated by consumers\' recognition of the ad as an implied social label.
Finding C: We found that co-occurring psychopathology is only a partial mediator of the association between PEs and suicidal behavior; that is, PEs are a marker of risk for later suicidal behavior in excess of the risk associated with co-occurring mental disorders.
Finding D: The study identified a significant association between corporal punishment during childhood and violence toward dating partners in adulthood.

Psychology_tweet_217_p$Psychology_462_p$.text:
Finding A: Across three studies, well-educated graduates who entered the workforce during economic downturns were more satisfied with their current jobs than those who entered during more prosperous economic times.
Finding B: Low self-esteem made the largest contribution to the variance, followed by high levels of perfectionism, body dissatisfaction, and symptoms of anxiety (see Table 4 ).
Finding C: These findings suggest that musical training could keep that window open longer.
Finding D: always wanted to discuss circumcision on #autism boards? Here is your chance
